class Functor f c d => Full f c d | f c -> d, f d -> c where

Documentation
class Functor f c d => Full f c d | f c -> d, f d -> c where

A Full Functor F : C -> D provides for every pair of objects c, c' in C and every morphism g : F c -> F c'l in D, a morphism g' : c -> c' in C. In short map has a right-inverse under composition. 

 map . premap = id
Methods
premap :: d (f a) (f b) -> c a b
Instances
Full Identity (->) (->)
Full f k k => Full f (Dual k) (Dual k)
class Functor f c d => Faithful f c d | f c -> d, f d -> c
Instances
Faithful Identity (->) (->)
Faithful f k k => Faithful f (Dual k) (Dual k)
unmap :: (Full f c d, Faithful f c d) => d (f a) (f b) -> c a b

For every pair of objects a and b in C a Full Faithful Functor F : C -> D maps every morphism f : a -> b onto a distinct morphism f : T a -> T b (since it is faithful) and every morphism from g : T a -> T b can be obtained from some f. (It maps Hom-sets bijectively, or in short map has both a left and right inverse under composition. 

 unmap . map = id
